basalis Horn, 1884: 187

10,000 feet ; [ Note: See lectotype designation by Smetana, 1995e]. Originally cited from Swift Current, British America; Wyoming ).

ebeninus Gravenhorst, 1802: 170
(
Staphylinus
; Type locality: Brunsvigae).

— Erichson, 1839a: 461 (
Philonthus
; [ Note: Misidentification: Bernhauer and Schubert, 1914: 336 cited
varians Erichson
as a synonym of
ebeninus Gravenhorst
; Erichson did not describe the species as new, he attributed it to Fabricius who attributed it to Paykull]; characters; Germany ).

— Grimm, 1845: 135 (
Philonthus
; with
Formica rufa
; Germany ).

— Wüsthoff, 1934: 60 (
Philonthus
; cited as ebenius ; illustration of aedeagus).

Philonthus
; subgenus
Philonthus
; characters; Denmark ).

— Lohse, 1964: 182 (
Philonthus
; subgenus
Philonthus
; characters; central Europe).

— Horion, 1965: 157 (
Philonthus
; widespread in southern and central Europe, sparse in northern Europe).

-
DISTRIBUTION: Egypt , Algeria , Canary Islands, Madeira, Europe, Russia , Georgia, Turkey , Syria , Iran , Turkmenistan , Mongolia .
